original_title: Sri Lanka bond yields, rupee steady at open
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s bond yields were steady at open on Friday, dealers said while the Central Bank’s guidance peg for interbank transactions remained steady.
“The investors must be taking a waiting approach with a bond auction coming on next February 27” a dealer said.
A bond maturing on 15.05.2026 was quoted at 29.40/60percent on Friday, steady from Thursday’s closing at 29.50/80 percent.
A bond maturing on 01.05.2027 was quoted at 29.10/15 percent on Friday, steady from at 29.10/25 percent.
A bond maturing on 01.02.2025 was quoted at 32.10/40 percent on Friday, unchanged.
The Central Bank’s guidance peg for interbank US dollar transactions depreciated by one cent to 362.67 rupee from 362.66 against the US dollar. (Colombo/Feb 24/2023)
